title: Autonomous Revenue Cycle Vision
summary: 150+ AI agents creating end-to-end agentic network for healthcare billing automation with $15.5B in prevented denials

content.whatItIs: Waystar announced agentic intelligence at JPM 2026, articulating a vision for the 'autonomous revenue cycle'—where AI agents handle healthcare billing, denials, and claims without human intervention.
howItWorks: 2025: Processed 7.5+ billion insurance transactions—proprietary data as key differentiator
July 2025: Acquired Iodine Software (processes one in three clinical hospital discharges) adding 'troves of new data to train and refine AI models'
Building 'dynamic, end-to-end agentic network that continuously acts within workflows, executes defined tasks, and learns from outcomes with minimal intervention'
In seconds, agentic AI analyzes full medical record, prioritizes 30,000 most relevant data points, auto-populates correction requests with clinical context
content.coreInsight: Healthcare administrative AI should aim for 'autonomous' rather than 'assisted' operations. Build agentic networks (150+ models) that execute tasks end-to-end. Proprietary transaction data (7.5B+ annually) becomes the moat. The TAM expansion thesis: AI transforms market size, not just market share.
content.keyMetrics: $15.5B in prevented denials. ~40% reduction in manual correction workload. 95% time savings in denial-related workflows. TAM projected to grow from $20-25B to $55B by 2030.
